Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2009 01:24PM vbabey wrote: Good Morning All. Hope everyone has  good day today! I got chemo #2 Wed, feels alot different, a little more shakey, and aware of all the meds in my body, have not taken Ativan, but yesterday after my shot felt a little naseaus from 3:00 on. I will have to try it. My hair is all over the place, cant wash it now for three days. Today is the big day!  I had the hairdresser coming tonite to shave it, but opted out and instead my husband and my two teenage girls are going to share the duty. I think they can keep it a little lighter for me.  I will be taking my first Ativan for that for sure.   Sanaisa- I was recommended for my constiption the two senna s morning and night, if that doesnt work, after one day with no bm, mix 1/3 cup raisin or prunes, 1/3 cup applesauce and 1/3 cup bran, mix together take two tsp with 8 oz water at bedtime, then if no bm for two days have Smooth Move Tea, then 3rd day add mirlax to the above. So far I have been doing well with the 4 senna-s daily, I go alot, but I am more relaxed now about that.  I read your post about the rads vs heart damage. At age 38 my brother in law was dx'd with a fatal case of mesotheliomia in 1994, went to many well known specialists, including top docs at Sloan Kettering, most said even with surgury, he only had maybe a year and a half, he chose a young aggresive doc at columbia pres in ny and he is still here with us! Breaking records.He probably got the most aggresive rads possible. Dx'd recently with blocked arteries, he recently underwent an attempt at a bypass, but they had to close him up unsuccessfully as yes, his heart has been damaged and sort of merged with his back, I am sure there is a better medical term for that, but I dont know it, sorry! . Anyway, days later they did the riskier stent op, risky because of where the stents had to be put it, corners and such, with such a out of place heart, but he came through fine a month ago. Docs are amazing today. Who knows where he would be without the radiation?
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2009 07:07AM vbabey wrote: Sanista, we are all feeling very bad in different ways and some people just dont know what to say to any of us...forget them!!! I am lucky to have a supportive husband, my daughters are teens, they are great, but life goes on for them...I can't cry to them everyday...even though I sometimes want to scream and say "I have F'king cancer!! Not a good one!! What are you complaining about!!But I just keep quiet.  As I told you, I get some wise words from my doomed but still surviving brother in law, who called me over the weekend because I felt so sick and out of it, and he said to me, "I can't tell you you are going to feel better, cause you won't. Look at it like you are in a really, really bad dream...one day you will wake up and it will be over!! And that will be it. For now just plow through and take one day at a time.  I hope you stick with your friends, they are the best people to have around you. Thanks for the Taxol tips, I feel better prepared and will see my oncologist today to see how things are for me and dicuss Gemzar added to my Taxol. Must reccommend again that book, by the way Crazy, Sexy, Cancer..loved it, loved it, made me laugh out loud throughout this mess! If you haven't read it please do...saw the movie, but the book is much better I think!!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2009 01:57PM vbabey wrote: Hi Ladies, Have not been on in awhile...cisplatin and taxatore first treatment did me in I guess, have had constipation and now diarrhea, trying to get back on track...still reading, thinking of you all, hugs, Veronica
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2009 08:10AM vbabey wrote: Hi all. I am working today, locked in my office, already we have had four swine flu dignosed here this morning!  Stayin far away, but just wanted to remind all of you again of the precautions we must take. Germs enter through the nose and mouth really so we must make sure we do not touch the face!  Blowing the nose once a day is a good thing and i wash my hands all the time. After the store, after the groceries are unloaded, after opening my wallet, etc. Hopefully they will not dry out and shrivel up! I've heard that a little neosporin dabbed on the nose may prevent an airborne from lodging there, but this is debatable. Just a reminder for all of you, stay healty, feel good! Think I now have an UTI from the magic mouthwash, just cant get rid of those issues downstairs! 3rd AC tomorrow...thinking of all of you.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2009 10:32AM vbabey wrote: Hi all! It is good to hear mny of you moving on...my third AC last Wednesday was my worst, but I guess thats the way it can go...SE' did not really start to bother me until Sat, like you ScoobyDoo, the relfux came on sudden and strong so I have added that to my regimen of meds!  I was not sleeping at all waking up all hours of the night which can ruin your day, so they have me taking more Ativan at night now than I use to and last nite I slept great. I take the yogurt to really prevent a yeast or bacterial infection from this strong mouthwash I can not seem to get off yet, I have not reasearched it's benefits, but I will now that I feel better. At work, I will check in later! Hope you all have a good day!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2009 12:49PM vbabey wrote: Hello all!  Just wishing everyone a good chemo week ahead (as many of us are "on" this week like me).I am thinking of you all and hope all goes well.  i had to stay in the last few days again as my WBC was .4! Seems I swoop down a week after chemo but seem to swoop back up the following week so no chemo has been delayed. But I feel a little trapped around the house that second week. Is anyone else wbc low like that? They told me to be very cautious and stay in. Hugs to all!

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2009 04:59PM vbabey wrote: Hi all! Good news, saw my onco yesterday and my nasty fast growing, out of nowhere tumor has shrunk from 9cm to 3 cm after 4 treatments!  I am in a good mood!  Too bad I am changing meds. Onty, hope you are feeling better. Lisa, Congrats to you!! So happy! Hope everybody else is having a good weekend.  Hugs!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2009 07:30PM vbabey wrote: Hi all, I started chemo two days ago. Taking AC 4 rounds first, then 4 more after that of other chemo to be decided. No port was necessary Taking Emend, Deacradon, and Zoloft and did use a suppository due to some naseau first nite. Also am taking Lax + stool softener each night and lots of water.  Got my first shot today of the Neulasta, told to expect some symtoms tommorow...my first day back to work. I am really just terrified of losing my hair.  I have a wig ready, and still need to pick up scarves and stuff. Carrying a chemo bag with me with Tylenol and antibiotic ointment, the special mouthwash and toothbrush, etc. Staying very positive. Good luck everyone!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2009 02:49PM vbabey wrote: Hello Ladies. I am one who does not post as much, but you must know that I read yours everyday! Sometimes I just cant think of what to say.   Thanks for keeping up on all of your posting, I must tell you I love reading them and always feel better when I do.  I had to get hydrated yesterday as I guess my mouth or throat is getting sorer each day and I cannot eat without taking advil or Tylenol first. I see you had the same thing unklewifeonty. I was so worried that I had contracted my daughter's mono, so I slipped into work early(as my second week I work from home to avoid all those swine flu patients1) and my friend, the nurse practitioner saw me and said she didn't  see anything there. But it is so painful, so they brought me in, hydrated me and called in the magic mouthwash. Hopefully it will go away already!  Still have bottom issues also, I am going ok, no more constipation, but these hemmoroids are killing me!  Never left from the get go after that first bad experience. What a pain in the ass they are :)! Just keep treating them nicely and hopefully they will disappear. My levels were extremely low, so I was advised to stay home next couple of days. So I will. I had a breast MRI done Wednesday, the oncologist has not called yet with the results, but i have seen a copy already (working for a doctor has its benefits!) and I am bummed that my tumor is 5 cm! i guess it has grown or i guess I am hoping that they were wrong in the first place. My axilla node has shrunk according to the report to 1.4 from 3 cm.  I will just wait to see how this is all explained. I cried a little, wondering maybe if I should now be up a bit in the staging, but feel much betterr now, so many people battle worse cancers! I loves to hear you all describe the chemo room, our is open, and widepread and the two nurses are very friendly, it is mostly older, but there are young people there, yesterday there was a twenty year old young man with down syndrome who took it like a professional and left with a lollipop, how brave must he be!  Somedays its so feisty and others its a snooze fest! I prefer the feisty days. Anyway, thinking of each and every one of you,and good luck to you who are moving on to Taxol. Please all have a great weekend!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2009 03:53AM vbabey wrote: Hi Mary, mine came off day 17, but it started to fall out natually about right around when my second treatment was being given.. Taking the advice of the ladies on this forum, when it started to fall out every time I brushed, I did not wash it, because they say it then clumps out, but instead used spritzer and a bandana over some of it to keep it there until the weekend.I cancelled the hairdresser an instead had my husband and two daughters shave it for me. Well, really just him, they were nervous! Traumatizing, yes, but my daughters filmed it on the computer and then they put music to it so we have a home video!  They were great!  Still have eylashes and eyebrows. Yea! Also AC 1 hardest as I did not take enough stool softner and AC 2 the worst for feeling bad in general
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2009 04:11PM vbabey wrote: Onty,Scooby and Mrsb45,  congrats on your last A/C! My last was today also! Halfway there now. I have appnt with onco on Wed, i guess she will inform me also of that large dose, wow I was not aware of that, thanks for the warning. My wbc was very high again they were thrilled and I guess I just go way up and way down.  Last Friday I called the onco again, about my ongoing painful BMs,(they must be sick of me) and they finally told me I could see a gastro with all sorts of restrictions about the exam, NO COLONOSCOPY...etc, they were nice about it, but said if it gives you peace of mind...and maybe it did, but it did a little more than that.  I got a quick appnt and I saw the nurse practitioner first who questioned me about the type of pain I was in , and then saw the gastro. i guess they think I am ok, but he prescribed me an Analpram Kit, which the onco ok'd.  When my husband brought home the box from the pharmacy, I felt like a little kid ripping open a Christmas gift again. I was never so happy to see the tubes and inserts and specially medicated wipes. I feel better already. It amazes me what can truly make me happy these days!  The chemo nurses were happy that I pressed the issue. Hugs to everyone this week! Hope u all had a good day today!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2009 06:20AM vbabey wrote: Onty, so sorry your Taxol did not go well...seems it happens alot...I go for my first tomorow, nervous, but anxious to get moving here to beat this!  Seems ridiculous that they kicked you off trial...interestd to see how onco explains this...hope your SE's are minimal anyway! Brunettesrule,  thinking of you and hoping you will quickly get better and move on. Try to say positive...I know it must be so hard, but better off seeing docs daily to make sure you are getting BETTER!!   Scoody, that taxol news is encouraging...still having hemm issues, but have been checked, no fissure and mouth sores still here!...Hopefully they will disappear shorty, at least I can't overeat! Scoby,  Onty and Lisa, I only have to take six steroids and also plenty of Benadryl and Taggamet before...did you all take that beforehand?
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2009 09:27AM vbabey wrote: Hi Ladies! Went in for chemo this morning and got some surprises, good and bad. The order was reviewed by nurses this morning and was for Taxol. When I got there, they were changed. I had been to the ocno on Friday, and when i asked abut the chemo meds, the Taxol and Gemzar addition, she told me she still had to consult with some colleagues she knew at Dana Farber, so Gemzar was still up in the air. I was happy to hear that they were looking out for me and called twice yesterday and spoke to the nurse, to see if any new orders were in yet, but she did not let me know by 5:30. When I got to the treatment area, they took my blood and then went into a tizzy as they discovered there were new orders for Cisplatin and Docetaxel (Taxotere) just placed this morning after they reviewed the Taxol orders.I had no emend with me and had taken all these premeds ad this treatment is 7 hours at least, maybe 8 the first time. What a waste! They had to find the onco and they rescheduled me for monday. My wbc was so good and i am so happy that I can have a nice Thanksgiving and weekend with my family. Yah!  Not thinking about the new side effects until I have to, apparently they are much worse. I am scheduled for treatment every three weeks which will now push surgury off to much later. I don't even know how many treatments I will be getting. But if it will help me, bring it on! Scooby, i did use the biotene often, but got sores anyway. Now I use the mgc mthwsh four time daily...seems I may be doomed as one of my new chemo meds causes mouth sores!  Lisa, love your attitude after so much went wrong. Still looking forward to that finish line, although I my come in last place!! Onty, seems like there are more pro's than con's. That is a good thing. This may be a blessing in disguise. But what the heck is "gross wall motion abnormality visible"? Is it related to the cancer or is it side effect of the chemo? Hopbird- I think cooking for Thanksgving will be theraputic. I am looking forward to immersing myself in that kitchen with all of those good smells for as long as my body will allow, will keep my mind off things. i hope you and everbody feels good tommorow! To all of you, Happy Thanksgiving and thanks for being there!  Hugs, Veronica

Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2009 06:31PM vbabey wrote: Happy Holidays to all of you who have not moved on and those who have too...i have been thinking of you all and hope you all had some nice gatherings...Got my 6th round mon, do not feel good at all, I hate this chemo combo...so I have not been on...only two left, I will finish up around Feb 7th...Hugs, Veronica

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2010 02:40PM vbabey wrote: Hi all. Have not been on in quite some time...it is good to read your posts...Just got my last chemo Tuesday, finally done....surgery is pending for the 19th...does anybody think that very soon?  I seem to be good after two weeks....I see you have all moved onto rads, happy to see it seems a breeze...My PET shows no cancer...I am so happy...thinking of you all, veronica
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2009 02:08AM - edited Oct 12, 2009 02:11AM by vbabey Hi all, have not been on in a while.  I had a terrible time after the first chemo with constipation and lam only starting to feel better just in time for the second, with many creams and tucks. Thought my diet was perfect, apparently not.  Please God that that never happens again. I thought I was going to die. I guess I did not take enough stool softners, only one at night and so now was told by the nurse to completely avoid any brown rice even if it has fiber, which I did not know. I was very nervous about the after pain and my surgeon offered to look for me to make sure I was not torn. Lucky I was not, just very irritated. I had no other naseau, a little tired here and there,do not sleep at night so well, but all in all not too terrible. I got the Neulasta shot the day after in my forearm and  then my affected breast and my underarm where I know I have affected nodes was very painful.  Still feel it now and then.Very hopeful that this is chemo working.  Next treatment Wed and will start prepping properly tommorow.  My period is due very soon. Wondering if I am going to get it? Wishing you all a good week..
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2009 03:25PM vbabey wrote: Glad that everybody seems to be having a good week of chemo  Unclezwifey, I have a magic mouthwash that included nystatin and tetracyclin, as the sores were down in my thoat and I could not swallow, hence the swish and swallow directions, They worked really well and at the first sign of reoccurance, they told me to start again. I should have known to take in more probiotic yogurt once I started as it is an antibiotic, but now am on some other bottom meds to fix what turned out to be a bacterial infection, not a UTI. so feeling better now, well besides being in this perpetual drugged up state for the next three days. 3 down and 5 to go. Saiaisa, glad to hear you did not get sick and that your daughter is feeling better. That is good news! Melinda, I eat probiotic yogurt every day, I am interested in what you find out about that brand. I was reccommended to do a masectomy, but I will be pushing for both to go for sure. Why not? I just feel that I have no idea why or when this came up so, so fast and who's to say it can't happen again. As I cannot take the drugs afterward, I must prevent reoccurance any way I can. Hopefully it will be the right decision for me. Be careful next week all, thinkin of you always!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: vbabey wrote: Need some quick input here from anyone who has gone thru this...Dx'd with TNBC, III in one breast and lymph node...I had a bilateral masectomy, with immediate reconstruction, tissue expanders placed.and all but one fill done before i began radiation, started rads in April and finsished beginning of June...PS wants to switch out tissue expanders  in a few days..he thinks I am ready...this is only three months and a week or so after finishing rads..I think it may have something to do with the fact that I almost had an MRI recommended by my onco and before I went into machine, I felt sensation and told them to take me out of room...PS saw me after that and all seemed OK, but at first and last fill after rads last week, he said that the metal plates in expanders had de-magnatized and the one in the radiatied breast has now displaced...he filled my anyway, but no leakage or shrinkage has occured to date which is a very good sign...he said I can wait or go ahead, he does not think it will make a significant difference either way...I see some ladies wait 6 months or more after rads, but i dont know whats going on inside there after that suction in the mri room...i dont know what to do...saw my breast surgeon and radiation once, they think my radiated breast looks ok to have surgury...can anybody comment from experience??? THanks! Dx 9/16/2009, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: how long did you wait after rads to switch out implants? vbabey vbabey

Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2009 12:05PM vbabey wrote: I also stayed around home day 7 thru 10, I do billing for a pediatrician so I was able to set up a home system for a few months.  My daughter was diagnosed with mono right after my first treatment, so we have to avoid each other in the house and she is completely banned from poking around the kitchen during those days, poor thing. She is 14 so she understands. I lysol everything evey morning and use my antibacterial when out.  Just curious, what foods are meant to boost white blood cell count?
